intro: Harpachaena amplexifolia, commonly known as the clasping leaf harpachaena, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that often wrap around the stems, giving it its common name. Harpachaena amplexifolia typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as cloud forests. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
